Text saved: We often see small animals in cities and towns.
We see birds, squirrels, mice, and insects.
In the last few years, the news shows many stories.
These stories are about wild animals in cities.
More and more big animals come into cities.
In Vancouver, bears came into parks.
In Mumbai, leopards walked on the streets.
In Berlin, wild pigs came into gardens.
What happens when big animals come into cities?
Do people welcome them, or are people afraid of them?
Do people think they are a danger?
Or do people think they are a problem?
